name: scaleway
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing scaleway cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`scaleway` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/scaleway/terraform-provider-scaleway).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing scaleway cloud resources.

Names of permission sets bound to the rule.

$ scw iam permission-set list

deleteOnTermination.description:
Forces deletion of the root volume on instance termination.

> **Important:** Updates to `root_volume.size_in_gb` will be ignored after the creation of the server.

name.description: The name of the server.

sizeInGb.description:
Size of the root volume in gigabytes.
To find the right size use [this endpoint](https://api.scaleway.com/instance/v1/zones/fr-par-1/products/servers) and
check the `volumes_constraint.{min|max}_size` (in bytes) for your `commercial_type`.
Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

volumeId.description: The volume ID of the root volume of the server, allows you to create server with an existing volume. If empty, will be computed to a created volume ID.

volumeType.description: Volume type of root volume, can be `b_ssd` or `l_ssd`, default value depends on server type

key.description:
Key of the object to import

> **Note:** The type `unified` could be instantiated on both `l_ssd` and `b_ssd` volumes.

enable.description:
Set to `true` to enable Kubernetes patch version auto upgrades.
> **Important:** When enabling auto upgrades, the `version` field take a minor version like x.y (ie 1.18).

maintenanceWindowDay.description: The day of the auto upgrade maintenance window (`monday` to `sunday`, or `any`).

maintenanceWindowStartHour.description: The start hour (UTC) of the 2-hour auto upgrade maintenance window (0 to 23).

balanceSimilarNodeGroups.description: Detect similar node groups and balance the number of nodes between them.

disableScaleDown.description: Disables the scale down feature of the autoscaler.

estimator.description: Type of resource estimator to be used in scale up.

expander.description: Type of node group expander to be used in scale up.

expendablePodsPriorityCutoff.description: Pods with priority below cutoff will be expendable. They can be killed without any consideration during scale down and they don't cause scale up. Pods with null priority (PodPriority disabled) are non expendable.

ignoreDaemonsetsUtilization.description: Ignore DaemonSet pods when calculating resource utilization for scaling down.

maxGracefulTerminationSec.description: Maximum number of seconds the cluster autoscaler waits for pod termination when trying to scale down a node

scaleDownDelayAfterAdd.description: How long after scale up that scale down evaluation resumes.

scaleDownUnneededTime.description: How long a node should be unneeded before it is eligible for scale down.

scaleDownUtilizationThreshold.description: Node utilization level, defined as sum of requested resources divided by capacity, below which a node can be considered for scale down

clusterCaCertificate.description: The CA certificate of the Kubernetes API server.

host.description: The URL of the Kubernetes API server.

token.description: The token to connect to the Kubernetes API server.

clientId.description: A client id that all tokens must be issued for

groupsClaims.description: JWT claim to use as the user's group

issuerUrl.description: URL of the provider which allows the API server to discover public signing keys

requiredClaims.description: Multiple key=value pairs that describes a required claim in the ID Token

usernameClaim.description: JWT claim to use as the user name

name.description:
The name for the pool.
> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

maxSurge.description: The maximum number of nodes to be created during the upgrade

maxUnavailable.description: The maximum number of nodes that can be not ready at the same time

redirects.description: Redirect parameters when using an ACL with `redirect` action.

type.description: The redirect type. Possible values are: `location` or `scheme`.

code.description: The HTTP redirect code to use. Valid values are `301`, `302`, `303`, `307` and `308`.

target.description: An URL can be used in case of a location redirect (e.g. `https://scaleway.com` will redirect to this same URL). A scheme name (e.g. `https`, `http`, `ftp`, `git`) will replace the request's original scheme.

type.description: The redirect type. Possible values are: `location` or `scheme`.

httpFilter.description:
The HTTP filter to match. This filter is supported only if your backend protocol has an HTTP forward protocol.
It extracts the request's URL path, which starts at the first slash and ends before the question mark (without the host part).
Possible values are: `acl_http_filter_none`, `path_begin`, `path_end`, `http_header_match` or `regex`.

httpFilterOption.description: If you have `http_filter` at `http_header_match`, you can use this field to filter on the HTTP header's value.

httpFilterValues.description:
A list of possible values to match for the given HTTP filter.
Keep in mind that in the case of `http_header_match` the HTTP header field name is case-insensitive.

invert.description: If set to `true`, the condition will be of type "unless".

ipSubnets.description: A list of IPs or CIDR v4/v6 addresses of the client of the session to match.

hostHeader.description: The HTTP host header to use for HC requests.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for HC requests.

uri.description: The HTTPS endpoint URL to call for HC requests.

hostHeader.description: The HTTP host header to use for HC requests.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for HC requests.

sni.description: The SNI to use for HC requests over SSL.

uri.description: The HTTPS endpoint URL to call for HC requests.

certificateChain.description:
Full PEM-formatted certificate chain.

> **Important:** Updates to `custom_certificate` will recreate the load-balancer certificate.

commonName.description: Main domain of the certificate. A new certificate will be created if this field is changed.

subjectAlternativeNames.description:
Array of alternative domain names.  A new certificate will be created if this field is changed.

scaleway:cockpit/cockpit:Cockpit.description:
## Import

Cockpits can be imported using the `{project_id}`, e.g.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:cockpit/cockpit:Cockpit main 11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

scaleway:index/ipamIpReverseDns:IpamIpRe.description:
Manages Scaleway IPAM IP Reverse DNS.

## Import

IPAM IP reverse DNS can be imported using the `{region}/{id}`, e.g.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:index/ipamIpReverseDns:IpamIpReverseDns main fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

> **Important:** An IP can migrate from `nat` to `routed_ipv4` but cannot be converted back

scaleway:instance/securityGroup:Security.description:
## Import

Instance security group can be imported using the `{zone}/{id}`, e.g.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:instance/securityGroup:SecurityGroup web fr-par-1/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

description.description: The description of the security group.

enableDefaultSecurity.description: Whether to block SMTP on IPv4/IPv6 (Port 25, 465, 587). Set to false will unblock SMTP if your account is authorized to. If your organization is not yet authorized to send SMTP traffic, [open a support ticket](https://console.scaleway.com/support/tickets).

externalRules.description:
A boolean to specify whether to use instance_security_group_rules.
If `external_rules` is set to `true`, `inbound_rule` and `outbound_rule` can not be set directly in the security group.

inboundDefaultPolicy.description: The default policy on incoming traffic. Possible values are: `accept` or `drop`.

inboundRules.description: A list of inbound rule to add to the security group. (Structure is documented below.)

name.description: The name of the security group.

organizationId.description: The organization ID the security group is associated with.

outboundDefaultPolicy.description: The default policy on outgoing traffic. Possible values are: `accept` or `drop`.

outboundRules.description: A list of outbound rule to add to the security group. (Structure is documented below.)

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the security group is associated with.

stateful.description: A boolean to specify whether the security group should be stateful or not.

tags.description: The tags of the security group.

zone.description: `zone`) The zone in which the security group should be created.

description.description: The description of the security group.

enableDefaultSecurity.description: Whether to block SMTP on IPv4/IPv6 (Port 25, 465, 587). Set to false will unblock SMTP if your account is authorized to. If your organization is not yet authorized to send SMTP traffic, [open a support ticket](https://console.scaleway.com/support/tickets).

additionalVolumeIds.description:
The [additional volumes](https://developers.scaleway.com/en/products/instance/api/#volumes-7e8a39)
attached to the server. Updates to this field will trigger a stop/start of the server.

> **Important:** If this field contains local volumes, the `state` must be set to `stopped`, otherwise it will fail.

> **Important:** If this field contains local volumes, you have to first detach them, in one apply, and then delete the volume in another apply.

bootType.description: The boot Type of the server. Possible values are: `local`, `bootscript` or `rescue`.

bootscriptId.description: The ID of the bootscript to use  (set boot_type to `bootscript`).

cloudInit.description: The cloud init script associated with this server

enableDynamicIp.description: If true a dynamic IP will be attached to the server.

enableIpv6.description: Determines if IPv6 is enabled for the server.

image.description:
The UUID or the label of the base image used by the server. You can use [this endpoint](https://api-marketplace.scaleway.com/images?page=1&per_page=100)
to find either the right `label` or the right local image `ID` for a given `type`. Optional when creating an instance with an existing root volume.

You can check the available labels with our [CLI](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/compute/instances/api-cli/creating-managing-instances-with-cliv2/). ```scw marketplace image list```

To retrieve more information by label please use: ```scw marketplace image get label=<LABEL>```

ipId.description: The ID of the reserved IP that is attached to the server.

ipIds.description:
List of ID of reserved IPs that are attached to the server. Cannot be used with `ip_id`.

> `ip_id` to `ip_ids` migration: if moving the ip from the old `ip_id` field to the new `ip_ids`, it should not detach the ip.

ipv6Address.description: The default ipv6 address routed to the server. ( Only set when enable_ipv6 is set to true )

ipv6Gateway.description: The ipv6 gateway address. ( Only set when enable_ipv6 is set to true )

ipv6PrefixLength.description: The prefix length of the ipv6 subnet routed to the server. ( Only set when enable_ipv6 is set to true )

name.description: The name of the server.

organizationId.description: The organization ID the server is associated with.

placementGroupId.description:
The [placement group](https://developers.scaleway.com/en/products/instance/api/#placement-groups-d8f653) the server is attached to.


> **Important:** When updating `placement_group_id` the `state` must be set to `stopped`, otherwise it will fail.

placementGroupPolicyRespected.description: True when the placement group policy is respected.

privateIp.description: The Scaleway internal IP address of the server.

privateNetworks.description:
The private network associated with the server.
Use the `pn_id` key to attach a [private_network](https://developers.scaleway.com/en/products/instance/api/#private-nics-a42eea) on your instance.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the server is associated with.

publicIp.description: The public IP address of the server.

publicIps.description: The list of public IPs of the server.

replaceOnTypeChange.description: If true, the server will be replaced if `type` is changed. Otherwise, the server will migrate.

rootVolume.description: Root [volume](https://developers.scaleway.com/en/products/instance/api/#volumes-7e8a39) attached to the server on creation.

routedIpEnabled.description:
If true, the server will support routed ips only. Changing it to true will migrate the server and its IP to routed type.

> **Important:** Enabling routed ip will restart the server

securityGroupId.description: The [security group](https://developers.scaleway.com/en/products/instance/api/#security-groups-8d7f89) the server is attached to.

state.description: The state of the server. Possible values are: `started`, `stopped` or `standby`.

tags.description: The tags associated with the server.

type.description:
The commercial type of the server.
You find all the available types on the [pricing page](https://www.scaleway.com/en/pricing/).
Updates to this field will migrate the server, local storage constraint must be respected. [More info](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/compute/instances/api-cli/migrating-instances/).
Use `replace_on_type_change` to trigger replacement instead of migration.

> **Important:** If `type` change and migration occurs, the server will be stopped and changed backed to its original state. It will be started again if it was running.

Allow plain and server-authenticated TLS connections in addition to mutually-authenticated ones.

> **Important:** Updates to `allow_insecure` can disconnect eventually connected devices.

allowMultipleConnections.description:

> **Important:** Updates to `allow_multiple_connections` can disconnect eventually connected devices.

messageFilters.description: Rules that define which messages are authorized or denied based on their topic.

scaleway:kubernetes/pool:Pool.description:
## Import

Kubernetes pools can be imported using the `{region}/{id}`, e.g.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:kubernetes/pool:Pool mypool fr-par/11111111-1111-1111-1111-111111111111
```

autohealing.description: Enables the autohealing feature for this pool.

autoscaling.description:
Enables the autoscaling feature for this pool.
> **Important:** When enabled, an update of the `size` will not be taken into account.

clusterId.description: The ID of the Kubernetes cluster on which this pool will be created.

containerRuntime.description:
The container runtime of the pool.
> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

createdAt.description: The creation date of the pool.

currentSize.description: The actual size of the pool

kubeletArgs.description: The Kubelet arguments to be used by this pool

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the pool, used by the autoscaling feature.

minSize.description: The minimum size of the pool, used by the autoscaling feature.

name.description:
The name for the pool.
> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

nodeType.description:
The commercial type of the pool instances. Instances with insufficient memory are not eligible (DEV1-S, PLAY2-PICO, STARDUST). `external` is a special node type used to provision from other Cloud providers.

> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

nodes.description: (List of) The nodes in the default pool.

placementGroupId.description:
The [placement group](https://developers.scaleway.com/en/products/instance/api/#placement-groups-d8f653) the nodes of the pool will be attached to.
> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

publicIpDisabled.description:
Defines if the public IP should be removed from Nodes. To use this feature, your Cluster must have an attached Private Network set up with a Public Gateway.
> **Important:** Updates to this field will recreate a new resource.

region.description: `region`) The region in which the pool should be created.

rootVolumeSizeInGb.description: The size of the system volume of the nodes in gigabyte

rootVolumeType.description: System volume type of the nodes composing the pool

size.description:
The size of the pool.
> **Important:** This field will only be used at creation if autoscaling is enabled.

tags.description:
The tags associated with the pool.
> Note: As mentionned in [this document](https://github.com/scaleway/scaleway-cloud-controller-manager/blob/master/docs/tags.md#taints), taints of a pool's nodes are applied using tags. (Example: "taint=taintName=taineValue:Effect")

updatedAt.description: The last update date of the pool.

waitForPoolReady.description: Whether to wait for the pool to be ready.

zone.description:
`zone`) The zone in which the pool should be created.

failoverHost.description:
Scaleway S3 bucket website to be served in case all backend servers are down.
> **Note:** Only the host part of the Scaleway S3 bucket website is expected:
e.g. 'failover-website.s3-website.fr-par.scw.cloud' if your bucket website URL is 'https://failover-website.s3-website.fr-par.scw.cloud/'.

forwardPort.description: User sessions will be forwarded to this port of backend servers.

forwardPortAlgorithm.description: Load balancing algorithm. Possible values are: `roundrobin`, `leastconn` and `first`.

forwardProtocol.description: Backend protocol. Possible values are: `tcp` or `http`.

healthCheckHttp.description: This block enable HTTP health check. Only one of `health_check_tcp`, `health_check_http` and `health_check_https` should be specified.

healthCheckHttps.description: This block enable HTTPS health check. Only one of `health_check_tcp`, `health_check_http` and `health_check_https` should be specified.

healthCheckMaxRetries.description: Number of allowed failed HC requests before the backend server is marked down.

healthCheckPort.description: Port the HC requests will be send to.

healthCheckSendProxy.description: Defines whether proxy protocol should be activated for the health check.

healthCheckTcp.description: This block enable TCP health check. Only one of `health_check_tcp`, `health_check_http` and `health_check_https` should be specified.

healthCheckTimeout.description: Timeout before we consider a HC request failed.

healthCheckTransientDelay.description: The time to wait between two consecutive health checks when a backend server is in a transient state (going UP or DOWN).

ignoreSslServerVerify.description: Specifies whether the Load Balancer should check the backend serverâ€™s certificate before initiating a connection.

lbId.description:
The load-balancer ID this backend is attached to.
> **Important:** Updates to `lb_id` will recreate the backend.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of connections allowed per backend server.

maxRetries.description: Number of retries when a backend server connection failed.

name.description: The name of the load-balancer backend.

onMarkedDownAction.description: Modify what occurs when a backend server is marked down. Possible values are: `none` and `shutdown_sessions`.

proxyProtocol.description: Choose the type of PROXY protocol to enable (`none`, `v1`, `v2`, `v2_ssl`, `v2_ssl_cn`)

redispatchAttemptCount.description: Whether to use another backend server on each attempt.

sendProxyV2.description: DEPRECATED please use `proxy_protocol` instead - (Default: `false`) Enables PROXY protocol version 2.

serverIps.description: List of backend server IP addresses. Addresses can be either IPv4 or IPv6.

sslBridging.description: Enables SSL between load balancer and backend servers.

stickySessions.description: The type of sticky sessions. The only current possible values are: `none`, `cookie` and `table`.

stickySessionsCookieName.description: Cookie name for sticky sessions. Only applicable when sticky_sessions is set to `cookie`.

timeoutConnect.description: Maximum initial server connection establishment time. (e.g.: `1s`)

timeoutQueue.description: Maximum time for a request to be left pending in queue when `max_connections` is reached. (e.g.: `1s`)

Scaleway S3 bucket website to be served in case all backend servers are down.
> **Note:** Only the host part of the Scaleway S3 bucket website is expected:
e.g. 'failover-website.s3-website.fr-par.scw.cloud' if your bucket website URL is 'https://failover-website.s3-website.fr-par.scw.cloud/'.

> **Important:** Updates to `lb_id` will recreate the backend.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of connections allowed per backend server.

maxRetries.description: Number of retries when a backend server connection failed.

name.description: The name of the load-balancer backend.

onMarkedDownAction.description: Modify what occurs when a backend server is marked down. Possible values are: `none` and `shutdown_sessions`.

proxyProtocol.description: Choose the type of PROXY protocol to enable (`none`, `v1`, `v2`, `v2_ssl`, `v2_ssl_cn`)

redispatchAttemptCount.description: Whether to use another backend server on each attempt.

sendProxyV2.description: DEPRECATED please use `proxy_protocol` instead - (Default: `false`) Enables PROXY protocol version 2.

serverIps.description: List of backend server IP addresses. Addresses can be either IPv4 or IPv6.

sslBridging.description: Enables SSL between load balancer and backend servers.

stickySessions.description: The type of sticky sessions. The only current possible values are: `none`, `cookie` and `table`.

stickySessionsCookieName.description: Cookie name for sticky sessions. Only applicable when sticky_sessions is set to `cookie`.

timeoutConnect.description: Maximum initial server connection establishment time. (e.g.: `1s`)

timeoutQueue.description: Maximum time for a request to be left pending in queue when `max_connections` is reached. (e.g.: `1s`)

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Backend resources.

failoverHost.description:
Scaleway S3 bucket website to be served in case all backend servers are down.
> **Note:** Only the host part of the Scaleway S3 bucket website is expected:
e.g. 'failover-website.s3-website.fr-par.scw.cloud' if your bucket website URL is 'https://failover-website.s3-website.fr-par.scw.cloud/'.

forwardPort.description: User sessions will be forwarded to this port of backend servers.

forwardPortAlgorithm.description: Load balancing algorithm. Possible values are: `roundrobin`, `leastconn` and `first`.

forwardProtocol.description: Backend protocol. Possible values are: `tcp` or `http`.

healthCheckHttp.description: This block enable HTTP health check. Only one of `health_check_tcp`, `health_check_http` and `health_check_https` should be specified.

healthCheckHttps.description: This block enable HTTPS health check. Only one of `health_check_tcp`, `health_check_http` and `health_check_https` should be specified.

healthCheckMaxRetries.description: Number of allowed failed HC requests before the backend server is marked down.

healthCheckPort.description: Port the HC requests will be send to.

healthCheckSendProxy.description: Defines whether proxy protocol should be activated for the health check.

healthCheckTcp.description: This block enable TCP health check. Only one of `health_check_tcp`, `health_check_http` and `health_check_https` should be specified.

healthCheckTimeout.description: Timeout before we consider a HC request failed.

healthCheckTransientDelay.description: The time to wait between two consecutive health checks when a backend server is in a transient state (going UP or DOWN).

ignoreSslServerVerify.description: Specifies whether the Load Balancer should check the backend serverâ€™s certificate before initiating a connection.

matchHostHeader.description:
The HTTP host header to match. Value to match in the HTTP Host request header from an incoming connection.
Only one of `match_sni` and `match_host_header` should be specified.

> **Important:** This field should be set for routes on HTTP Load Balancers.

matchSni.description:
The Server Name Indication (SNI) value to match. Value to match in the Server Name Indication TLS extension (SNI) field from an incoming connection made via an SSL/TLS transport layer.
Only one of `match_sni` and `match_host_header` should be specified.

> **Important:** This field should be set for routes on TCP Load Balancers.

contentBasedDeduplication.description: Specifies whether to enable content-based deduplication. Defaults to `false`.

fifoQueue.description: Whether the queue is a FIFO queue. If true, the queue name must end with .fifo. Defaults to `false`.

messageMaxAge.description: The number of seconds the queue retains a message. Must be between 60 and 1_209_600. Defaults to 345_600.

messageMaxSize.description: The maximum size of a message. Should be in bytes. Must be between 1024 and 262_144. Defaults to 262_144.

visibilityTimeoutSeconds.description: The number of seconds a message is hidden from other consumers. Must be between 0 and 43_200. Defaults to 30.

contentBasedDeduplication.description: Specifies whether to enable content-based deduplication. Defaults to `false`.

scaleway:objectstorage/item:Item.description:
Creates and manages Scaleway object storage objects.
For more information, see [the documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/object-storage-feature/).

## Import

Objects can be imported using the `{region}/{bucketName}/{objectKey}` identifier, e.g.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:objectstorage/item:Item some_object fr-par/some-bucket/some-file
```

~> **Important:** The `project_id` attribute has a particular behavior with s3 products because the s3 API is scoped by project.

If you are using a project different from the default one, you have to specify the project ID at the end of the import command.

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import scaleway:objectstorage/item:Item some_object fr-par/some-bucket/some-file@xxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxx
```

bucket.description: The bucket's name or regional ID.

content.description: The content of the file to upload. Only one of `file`, `content` or `content_base64` can be defined.

contentBase64.description: The base64-encoded content of the file to upload. Only one of `file`, `content` or `content_base64` can be defined.

file.description: The name of the file to upload, defaults to an empty file. Only one of `file`, `content` or `content_base64` can be defined.

hash.description: Hash of the file, used to trigger upload on file change

metadata.description: Map of metadata used for the object, keys must be lowercase

projectId.description: The project_id you want to attach the resource to

region.description: The Scaleway region this bucket resides in.

storageClass.description: Specifies the Scaleway [storage class](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/storage/object/concepts/#storage-class) `STANDARD`, `GLACIER`, `ONEZONE_IA` used to store the object.

tags.description: Map of tags

clusterSize.description:
The number of nodes in the Redis Cluster.

> **Important:** You cannot set `cluster_size` to 2, you either have to choose Standalone mode (1 node) or Cluster mode
which is minimum 3 (1 main node + 2 secondary nodes)

> **Important:** If you are using the Cluster mode (>=3 nodes), you can set a bigger `cluster_size` than you initially
did, it will migrate the Redis Cluster but keep in mind that you cannot downgrade a Redis Cluster, so setting a smaller
`cluster_size` will destroy and recreate your Cluster.

> **Important:** If you are using the Standalone mode (1 node), setting a bigger `cluster_size` will destroy and
recreate your Cluster as you will be switching to the Cluster mode.

createdAt.description: The date and time of creation of the Redis Cluster.

name.description: The name of the Redis Cluster.

nodeType.description:
The type of Redis Cluster you want to create (e.g. `RED1-M`).

> **Important:** Updates to `node_type` will migrate the Redis Cluster to the desired `node_type`. Keep in mind that
you cannot downgrade a Redis Cluster.

password.description: Password for the first user of the Redis Cluster.

cpuLimit.description: The amount of vCPU computing resources to allocate to each container. Defaults to 140.

cronStatus.description: The cron status of the container.

deploy.description:
Boolean controlling whether the container is on a production environment.

Note that if you want to use your own configuration, you must consult our configuration [restrictions](https://www.scaleway.com/en/docs/compute/containers/reference-content/containers-limitations/#configuration-restrictions) section.

domainName.description: The native domain name of the container

errorMessage.description: The error message of the container.

maxConcurrency.description: The maximum number of simultaneous requests your container can handle at the same time. Defaults to 50.

maxScale.description: The maximum of number of instances this container can scale to. Default to 20.

memoryLimit.description: The memory computing resources in MB to allocate to each container. Defaults to 256.

minScale.description: The minimum of running container instances continuously. Defaults to 0.

name.description: The unique name of the container name.

namespaceId.description:
The container namespace ID of the container.

> **Important** Updates to `name` will recreate the container.

The following arguments are optional:

port.description: The port to expose the container. Defaults to 8080.

privacy.description: The privacy type define the way to authenticate to your container. Please check our dedicated [section](https://developers.scaleway.com/en/products/containers/api/#protocol-9dd4c8).

protocol.description: The communication [protocol](https://developers.scaleway.com/en/products/containers/api/#protocol-9dd4c8) http1 or h2c. Defaults to http1.

region.description: (Defaults to provider `region`) The region in which the container was created.

registrySha256.description: The sha256 of your source registry image, changing it will re-apply the deployment. Can be any string.

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds during which your container can process a request before we stop it. Defaults to 300s.

cpuLimit.description: The amount of vCPU computing resources to allocate to each container. Defaults to 140.

scaleway:ipam/getIP:getIP.description:
Gets information about IP managed by IPAM service. IPAM service is used for dhcp bundled in VPCs' private networks.

## Examples

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getIP.

attached.description: Defines whether to filter only for IPs which are attached to a resource. Cannot be used with `ipam_ip_id`.

ipamIpId.description: The IPAM IP ID. Cannot be used with the rest of the arguments.

macAddress.description: The Mac Address linked to the IP. Cannot be used with `ipam_ip_id`.

privateNetworkId.description: The ID of the private network the IP belong to. Cannot be used with `ipam_ip_id`.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the IP is associated with.

region.description: `region`) The region in which the IP exists.

resource.description:
Filter by resource ID, type or name. Cannot be used with `ipam_ip_id`.
If specified, `type` is required, and at least one of `id` or `name` must be set.

tags.description:
The tags associated with the IP. Cannot be used with `ipam_ip_id`.
As datasource only returns one IP, the search with given tags must return only one result.

type.description: The type of the resource to get the IP from. [Documentation](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/scaleway/scaleway-sdk-go@master/api/ipam/v1#pkg-constants) with type list.

zonal.description: Only IPs that are zonal, and in this zone, will be returned.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getIP.

addressCidr.description: the IP address with a CIDR notation.

scaleway:loadbalancer/getCertificate:get.description:
Get information about Scaleway Load-Balancer Certificates.

This data source can prove useful when a module accepts an LB Certificate as an input variable and needs to, for example, determine the security of a certificate for your LB Frontend associated with your domain, etc.

For more information, see [the documentation](https://www.scaleway.com/en/developers/api/load-balancer/zoned-api/#path-certificate).

publicPort.description: The Public port to listen on.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVPC.

name.description: Name of the VPC. One of `name` and `vpc_id` should be specified.

organizationId.description: The ID of the organization the VPC is associated with.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the VPC is associated with.

vpcId.description: ID of the VPC. One of `name` and `vpc_id` should be specified.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVPC.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVPCs.

name.description: The VPC name used as filter. VPCs with a name like it are listed.

projectId.description: The ID of the project the VPC is associated with.

region.description: `region`). The region in which vpcs exist.

tags.description: List of tags used as filter. VPCs with these exact tags are listed.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVPCs.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

organizationId.description: The organization ID the VPC is associated with.

projectId.description: The ID of the project the VPC is associated with.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getOffer.

name.description: The offer name. Only one of `name` and `offer_id` should be specified.

offerId.description: The offer id. Only one of `name` and `offer_id` should be specified.

region.description: `region`) The region in which offer exists.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getOffer.

billingOperationPath.description: The unique identifier used for billing.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getWebHosting.

domain.description: The hosting domain name. Only one of `domain` and `webhosting_id` should be specified.

organizationId.description: The ID of the organization the hosting is associated with.

projectId.description: `project_id`) The ID of the project the hosting is associated with.

webhostingId.description: The hosting id. Only one of `domain` and `webhosting_id` should be specified.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getWebHosting.
